reviews.review: One of the most amazing games I've ever played.
Um dos meus Top Games, tanto em história como jogabilidade. Esse jogo vale muito o preço, mas pense em comprar o season pass junto, pq tem mais história.

This is a hard game to reccomend. The story is good, the graphics and gameplay are fluid but the game has far, far to much gore for my taste. Using melee combat just fills the screen with blood and bone and that is not something that I play games to see. The false shepherd trailer actually showcases this when the cop is "defaced". If excessive gore is not something that bothers you I can wholeheartedly reccomend this game. However, if it is, I would suggest giving Infinite a pass.
AMAZING!

I had a very rough time trying to like this game, and I ultimately failed.  This game is not anything that it was supposed to be, and I am deeply disappointed, considering how promising this title looked.  

     I could go on for a while and write an essay about how bland and overrated this game really is.  I mean that, but I know you won't read all of that dribble.  So I'll try and keep this short and sweet.  The weapons are heavily uninspired and generic of today's typical FPS.  The charaters are lazily written and cliche (sans the Luteces).  The story is atrociously played out and shows that the writers didn't understand the themes and concepts they were exploring, and it is blatantly obvious that the writers rushed the story out in less than a year, giving it a very small amount of actual death and lore (unlike the earlier titles in the Shock Series).  The gameplay is simple, go from point A to point B while shooting basic bad guys along the way, and is extremely linear.  The boss battles are underwhelming, the ending makes no sense, there is only ONE ending, the choices you make in the game don't fucking matter, the heavy hitters rarely appear, vigors are fucking horrible compared to plasmids, I can go on and on and on.  

   Want to know the actual good parts of this game?  Here they are.  Voice Acting, Visuals, PARTS of the soundtrack.  That is fucking it.  Don't buy it, you will be wasting your money.  It is a textbook example of bait-and-switch if you watch the early gameplay videos from the early 2010's.  Want a real FPS?  PLAY THE FIRST BIOSHOCK, or System Shock, if you really want to be cool.

This was my first plunge into the Bioshock series and the game was ok graphically, but the story was a little bit dull. Half way through you can see exactly what is coming and guess the ending if you're paying attention. To be honest, I was just playing it because it was on sale (and less than a week later, £3 cheaper in the weekend deal >.<) and I enjoyed shooting things. 

Overall, to much religion throughout the story. Average game play and a weak ending. Good if you just want to shoot stuff.
I love this game. It is truly a labor of love. It's only fault is that it is not as repayable as the previous installments.

BioShock Infinite bietet vielleicht kein besonders erfüllendes Shooter-Erlebnis, kann dafür aber mit einem einfallsreichen und stimmungsvollen Setting, sowie einer guten Geschichte punkten.

Booker DeWitt hat eine Schuld zu begleichen. Er soll eine junge Dame namens Elizabeth in der weit über den Wolken schwebenden Stadt Columbia finden und nach New York bringen. Der Auftrag erweist sich inmitten eines Bürgerkrieges und mit dem selbsternannten Propheten Comstock und seinem Songbird im Nacken als schwieriges Unterfangen. Zumal die Reise auch noch durch alternative Realitäten führt, wo stets zwei seltsame Zwillinge mit vagen Hinweisen warten.

Die Handlung stellt die starke Seite des Spiels dar. Die fliegende Stadt präsentiert sich nicht nur mit einer ausführlichen Hintergrundgeschichte, belauscht und beobachtet man die zahlreichen NPCs, so erfährt man auch mehr über die aktuelle Situation in Columbia. In der Stadt verteilte Audiotagebücher, im Spiel Voxophone genannt, geben noch tiefere Einblicke. Dabei werden für Computerspiele eher ungewöhnliche Themen wie Religion und Rassismus aufgegriffen. Auch werden die ungewöhnlichen Technologien und ihre Funktionsweise erläutert. Selbst für die ganzen gecoverten Songs im Spiel gibt es eine Erklärung. All das trägt dazu bei ein glaubhaftes Gesamtbild zu erzeugen. 
Ebenso weiß die Geschichte rund um Booker und Elizabeth zu faszinieren. Früh zeigt sich, dass mehr hinter dem Auftrag steckt, als es zunächst den Anschein hat. Im Spielverlauf ergründet man die Vergangenheit und auch eine denkbare Zukunft beider Charaktere. Am Ende wartet ein ziemlich ausgefallenes Ende, mit dem man so vielleicht nicht gerechnet hat.

Auch bei der Präsentation hat man sich redliche Mühe gegeben. Die Spielwelt präsentiert sich detailliert und abwechslungsreich in bester Graphik. Das liegt an den zahlreichen Stadtgebieten, die sich im Design merklich voneinander abgrenzen. Dazu kommen noch die verschiedenen Versionen von Columbia aus den anderen Dimensionen, die sich in gleicher Weise teils deutlich voneinander unterscheiden. Die deutsche Sprachausgabe ist ebenfalls gelungen, so wie auch die ungewöhnlichen Neuinterpretationen altbekannter Songs.

In einem Punkt ist der Titel aber nur bedingt erfolgreich. Als First-Person-Shooter kann das Spiel nur mäßig überzeugen. Die Begrenzung auf zwei Waffen schränkt zu sehr ein, zumal die Auswahl ohnehin nicht sonderlich groß und abwechslungsreich ausfällt. Zudem könnte es deutlich mehr verschiedene Gegnertypen geben. Kampfgebiete mit Sky-Line sind selten und fallen eher klein aus.
Erfreulich ist zumindest die Beteiligung von Elizabeth bei den Gefechten. So wirft sie gerne mal Munition zu, was bei dem stark begrenzten Vorrat äußerst praktisch ist. Gelegentlich kann man auch als Tränen bezeichnete Portale öffnen und so unter anderem Unterstützung herbeiholen. 

Die Vorzüge von BioShock Infinite liegen mehr in der Story und Präsentation als im Gameplay. Als Shooter ist es zwar kein Reinfall, aber eben auch kein Hit. Selbst auf hohen Schwierigkeitsgrad ist das Spiel nur selten fordernd, sofern man beim Ableben nicht direkt wieder vor einem Handyman erwacht. Doch die außerordentliche Darstellung der fliegenden Stadt vermag diesen Makel ausreichend zu kompensieren. Wer in eine überzeugende Welt mit bemerkenswerter Geschichte eintauchen will, der wird mit diesem Spiel gut bedient.

As a fan of the first bioshock, I was fairly disappointed with this game. It starts off very promising, the visuals are great with a few set pieces that really give the environment character. The story seems to be leading towards a certain direction until you finally meet elizabeth. From there the story takes a bit of turn. From then on the story becomes more and more convoluted, until the game finally ends. It seems as if the writers thought a baffling ending meant a good ending. All the while the gameplay begins to feel like more of a chore than fun. there are only a handful of unique enemies that are sparsely used throughout, making each fight feel like the last. Though the vigors and the rail system add a bit of diversity, they really cant overcome the rinse and repeat feel of the encounters. Meanwhile elizabeths special power seems very underutilised. [spoiler]For being able to tear through time, space, and alternate realities[/spoiler] all she provides for you is extra ammo, and a friendly turret here and there. Even in terms of the story, elizabeths power is mainly used to skip over events. I felt that this was a very lazy move on part of the writers. Rather than have the player achieve their goal, the writers say [spoiler]"elizabeth tears into an alternate reality! so now you dont have to do this objective! Because that would be totally boring, right?"[/spoiler] Overall the game is fairly mediocre. It begins with such promise and then stumbles and falls until the credits roll.

Excelente.
 Com um enredo complexo, o jogo se desenrola em uma cidade incrivelmente bela e cientificamente avançada, mas que logo demonstrará um lado brutal e sombrio em meio ao preconceito, escravidão e a aterrorizante evolução da ciência, até mesmo para os padrões da cidade. O que no leva a questionar: Até onde pode chegar a loucura de um povo que está "Acima de Todos"?

Obs.: Os fenômenos bizarros da física que o protagonista encontrará pelo caminho são esclarecidos de forma bem racional, sem pontas soltas, pelos excêntricos (e engraçados) irmãos Lutece, por isso é fundamental prestar atenção neles para entender a trama do jogo. Essa característica trouxe BioShock Infinite para a minha lista de jogos "Conceito".
Amazing and very emotional game overall! I reccomand this to anyone who wants to play this game!

Much deeper than i thought it would be. The original always held a place in my heart but i decided to wait on this one for whatever reason because a lot of reviews called the combat repetitive, which is true. The opening sequence is absolutely breathtaking, but from then on its kind of "shoot, rinse, repeat", but it's story takes a huge turn about halfway through the 40 hour story, that kept me hooked to completion. i absolutely reccomend it to anyone who enjoys interpreting stories in games.
très bon jeux j'ai aimé

The storyline of this game left so much to be desired. It's one of the most depressing stories I have ever experienced in any game. Terribly sorry to anyone who might have burnt money on this game.

The only redeeming feature this game had was its gameplay, but then I could experience the same kind of FPS mayhem in its predecessors or other FPS games. BioShock Infinite just left a gaping hole where my rectum once was.

In passing, sure, the game's a little fun, but it wasn't worth the time I put into it just to have the storyline kick me in the face.

+ Gripping story

+ Great technology (graphics and sound)

- A few sections feel like too much of a horde-mode (wave after wave of enemies)
- Ends at some point

Сейчас не так много игр играя в которых они вызывают притяжение, сравнимое с земной гравитацией для падающего объекта. Ещё меньше тех которые, именно, трогают за душу. Последнюю такую я встретил лет 8 назад и это "The Witcher" - он незабвенный ведьмак, первая часть. Вторая же сделала сильный уклон в сторону боевиков от сюжета.... И вот я решил поиграть в "Bioshock infinite", даже не знаю почему просто захотелось. Около 10 часов в течении двух суток он меня просто не отпускал. Вначале (к моему стыду я посчитал эту игру просто "очень красивым шутером ни меньше но и не больше", но потом когда я стал доходить до сути сюжета (Начиная со второй половины) просто офигел... Всем рекомендую кто любит не только просто пострелять, но ценит в играх Красоту сюжета и того как он подан. (Данный монолог является жестом раскаяния к этой игре, что вначале я её оценил как очередной шутер серии (ибо второй Bioshock я оценил именно так).

It's a really goodlooking game. I had great fun strolling around all the areas. And then I found Elizabeth and it all goes to hell. I wanted to throw that interrupting .... woman over the edge every time I encountered one. The game forces me to like her but I never did. If there was an option to shoot, set fire to, explode or just dismiss her I would have done it. Several times she advanced the plot while I was still fighting something. It really got annoying half way through the game and then I just gave up on following the plot. All that mattered to me was to reach the end of shooting gallery so she could do her thing and I could pour myself a drink. I didn't watch the end cut scene so I can't spoil it for you if I wanted to because I was putting the dishes in the washer.  

Good thing I bought Sid Meier's Pirates! at the same time. Had WAY more fun in that game.
Fuck yeah I recommend this game.

Jeu à acheter en solde uniquement, nettement moins intéressant et moins riche que le premier opus qui fut une merveille à son époque, un scénario alambiqué faussement compliqué et brouillon, mais avec quelques situations intéressantes.

L'univers de ce nouvel opus est vraiment magnifique et intéressant, mais bord*%#  c'est un foutu couloir ultra dirigiste avec peu de marge de manoeuvre et presque aucune exploration. Sans compter un détail scénaristique, que j'éviterai de vous spoiler, qui vous empêchera de retourner en arrière à de nombreuses reprises si vous aviez oublier un succès ou une serrure verrouillée en route.

Bref très décevant, mais néanmoins sympathique, d'où l'intérêt de l'acheter uniquement en promotion.

Absolutely the pinnacle of BioShock games. Set before the previous games, Infinite's Columbia city in the sky is a breath of fresh air compared to the dank claustrophobic chambers of Rapture. The story is as good if not better than previously, and the addition of the main character Booker DeWitt actually speaking and interacting with Elizabeth is a wonderful change to the mute protagonists of the past. Spanning between calm repressed utopian grandeur and the rise of troubled revolution to outright war and devastation is similarly a nice change to the post-apocalyptic decay of Rapture. 

Mechanically the game is much the same, though combat has more angles of attack outside of the skyless Rapture. The skyrail travel and combat are a fun addition. Weapons are more normal ballistics and limited to a much more rational carrying of only two, and thus having to make choices about what to carry as you go along. The added Shield on top of health, as well as Elizabeth's timely gifts of potions and ammo make resource management slightly less of an issue. Plasmids have been renamed Vigors, the passive Tonics have been replaced by clothing that are found and not bought. Again the hacking mechanics are simplified, this time down to an effect of one of the Vigors, in the place of the previous games' minigames.

"Но время океан, а не река. Зачем гнать волну, если она все равно сойдет на нет"...
Есть много игр, которые интересно играть, но только не Bioshock Infinite. В него нужно играть погружаясь в мир с головой, и чтобы понять все хитросплетения, придется пройти игру до конца, но поверьте это приключение на столько увлекательно, что его хочется растягивать, как хороший коньяк. Я прошел игру за 7 дней, и чувствую, что как будто сам побывал в Колумбии. Насколько же проработано окружение, чувствуется, что разработчики приложили руку как каждому кусту и фонтану! Давно не видел ничего подобного, а смотреть хочется дальше...и поверьте оно того стоит)
